I am looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our engineering  team at Flo. We are an IOT start-up building hardware and software solutions for water safety and conservation.

The ideal candidate would work on the collecting, storing, processing, and analyzing of huge sets of data. The primary focus will be on choosing optimal solutions to use for these purposes, then maintaining, implementing, and monitoring them. Previous ETL experience, Spark, Python, Scala, Kafka, Redshift, HDFS knowledge preferred.
Message me if you want to be part of a really strong engineering team. (For local candidates, must be authorized to work in US; no visa sponsorship provided.)
Backend engineers are in extremely high demand still. But somehow I’ve spoken to and screened close to 20 backend engineers in 2 months. So how am I doing this in the current ecosystem?

First knowledge is that Twitter and friend referrals are dead. Don’t focus there. All your contacts are looking for backend engineers as well. So it’s pointless. You have to go the extra mile and find the diamond in the rough. So I go to GitHub. GitHub search has a hidden feature which lets you search for users by code language. Search for “Node.js” or “Full Stack Engineer” and you’ll see user results (off to the far right) based on commits (contribution of that code to their profile). Once you’re there you can even do an advanced search and include location.

But here’s the kicker, I look at their projects, look at the code and figure out if there’s opportunity I can present to them. The chance to continue their passions. I’m not going to email every single person. I’m going to find someone who is passionate about similar subject matter, reach out and say we should talk. That’s the extra mile, taking the time to learn about them before even sending an email. Because you shouldn’t be recruiting, you should be building a team. And those are two things are very different.
TGIF LinkedIn! Is anyone looking for a change of scenery?

We assist with technical recruiting and sustainable growth across our portfolio.We are building a talent network of mobile engineers, full-stack, front-end and technical professionals for our portfolio of companies.
